brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the OTIS Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy Study is to monitor planned and
      unplanned pregnancies exposed to certain medications, to evaluate the possible teratogenic
      effect of these medications and to follow live born infants for one year after birth. With
      respect to fetal outcome, it is important to evaluate the spectrum of outcomes that may be
      relevant to a medication exposure during pregnancy, and these include both easily
      recognizable defects which are visible at birth, as well as more subtle or delayed defects
      that may not be readily identifiable without special expertise and observation beyond the
      newborn period.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stelara Pregnancy Exposure Registry OTIS Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy Project

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of the Stelara Pregnancy Exposure Registry OTIS Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy
      Project is to follow pregnant women or women who have delivered a baby, who have been
      treated with Stelara within 3 months of their last menstrual period (LMP) or during
      pregnancy to evaluate the possible effect of this medication on the pregnancy outcome
      including child development and growth up to one year of age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Documentation of an exposure to Stelara (ustekinumab) during pregnancy or within 3
             months prior to the first day of the last menstrual period (LMP) for any number of
             days, at any time, at any dose, and at any time until completion of pregnancy.

          -  Documentation of gestational timing of the exposure to Stelara (ustekinumab)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who have not have an exposure to Stelara (ustekinumab) during pregnancy.

study_pop.textblock:
Women who have had exposure to Stelara (ustekinumab) within 3 months of the last menstrual
        period, or anytime during pregnancy, and who reside in the U.S. or Canada.

link.description: Official research website of the Organization of Teratology Information Specialists, Studies coordinated at the University of California, San Diego

clinical_study.official_title: Stelara® Pregnancy Exposure Registry OTIS Autoimmune Diseases in Pregnancy Project

other_outcome.time_frame: From 3 months prior to the first day of the last menstrual period until the day of delivery

other_outcome.description: Pre- and post-natal fetal and infant growth, small for gestational age, and preterm delivery
other_outcome.time_frame: Birth to one year of age
From 3 months prior to the first day of the last menstrual period until the day of delivery

other_outcome.description: Health and development including effects to the immune system development.

primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the effect of certain medications when used in the first trimester of pregnancy with respect to major structural birth defects.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 3 months prior to the first day of the last menstrual period and up to one year of age

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Co-Director Center for Promotion of Maternal Health and Infant Development

secondary_outcome.description: One secondary objective of the study is to evaluate the effects of certain medications when used in the first trimester of pregnancy with respect to potential minor malformations.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At dysmorphological exam which will occur at one time point between birth and one year of age

collaborator.agency: The Organization of Teratology Information Specialists
